abstract: Vivendi, the French conglomerate, said Monday it had sold an initial chunk of its 20 percent stake in the media group NBC Universal to General Electric (GE.N) for $2 billion as it shifts its acquisition strategy.
snippet: Vivendi, the French conglomerate, said Monday it had sold an initial chunk of its 20 percent stake in the media group NBC Universal to General Electric (GE.N) for $2 billion as it shifts its acquisition strategy.
lead_paragraph: Vivendi, the French conglomerate, said Monday it had sold an initial chunk of its 20 percent stake in the media group NBC Universal to General Electric for $2 billion as it shifts its acquisition strategy, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Vivendi Sells $2 Billion Stake in NBC to G.E.
